verses.roman:
vatseṣu vatsa-rūpeṇa
praviśantaṁ jighāṁsayā
hatvā nyapātayat tena
kapitthāni ca līlayā

synonyms: vatseṣu—among the calves; vatsa-rūpeṇa—appearing as if another calf; praviśantam—who had entered; jighāṁsayā—wanting to kill; hatvā—killing him; nyapātayat—He made to fall; tena—by him; kapitthāni—the kapittha fruits; ca—and; līlayā—as a sport.
translation: Desiring to kill Kṛṣṇa, the demon Vatsa disguised himself as a calf and entered among Kṛṣṇa's calves. But Kṛṣṇa killed the demon and, using his body, enjoyed the sport of knocking kapittha fruits down from the trees.
